name: Philodendron Monkey Mask
description: Monkey Mask is a variety of Swiss Cheese Vine, this vine will grow long tendrils and can be left to trail down from a hanging pot or shelf, or trained up a trellace or moss pole. Either way, the stunning foliage makes for a dramatic statement

way_of_care.light: indirect light but will tolerate moderate shade
way_of_care.water: water when the soil has started to dry out
way_of_care.feed: feed once a month with a balanced fertiliser during the growing period

name: Chinese Evergreen
description: truly tropical gem, Aglaonema Christina has fresh, pale green central foliage with darker green leaf margins and central splashes. Great for improving air quality and easy to care for. Aglaonema Christina will add extra colour and texture to create a rain forest vibe at home or the office.

way_of_care.light: Aglaonema will thrive in low to bright light levels
way_of_care.water: Keep the soil moist at all times, do not allow it to dry out
way_of_care.feed: Slow release fertiliser once a month during the growing season
way_of_care.temperature: Normal room temperature 18-24°C, however avoid cold draughts

name: Elephant Ear
description: A gorgeous plant with stunning dark green leaves that really make the deep silver-white veins stand out. The leaves can grow to an astounding 30cm in length, adding a contemporary design quality to indoor spaces.

way_of_care.light: Thrives best in well lit, bright conditions, however direct sunlight will scorch the leaves
way_of_care.water: Keep the compost moist with warm water. Do not allow the soil to dry out, do not allow it to dry out
way_of_care.feed: Apply a slow release fertiliser once a month during the growing season
way_of_care.temperature: Needs to be kept warm, ideally between 18-22°C

name: Calathea Flamestar
description: The rich bold green and yellow markings of Calathea Flamestar make this a must-have houseplant to brighten up any room

way_of_care.light: As with most variegated plants, Calathea need plenty of diffused light however direct sunlight will cause the leaves to fade and lose their markings. They can tolerate some degree of shade, but the better the light conditions, the more you will be rewarded by fine foliage
way_of_care.water: Calathea must be kept in damp soil at all times, but definitely do not allow the plant to sit in water or in very wet soil. Think little and often as a watering policy
way_of_care.feed: Apply a weak dose of a nitrogen rich foliage fertiliser once or twice a month during the growing season
way_of_care.temperature: Prefers warm to high temperatures, ideally between 18-23°C but can cope with as low as 15°C. Avoid draughts and ensure the plant has reasonable ventilation

name: Calathea picturata Crimson
description: Calathea Crimson is a stunning Calathea variety. Deep pink centered leaves with a deep green-black border. Please note: Calathea Crimson is only available for sale during the spring and summer months.

way_of_care.light: As with most variegated plants, Calathea need plenty of diffused light however direct sunlight will cause the leaves to fade and lose their markings. They can tolerate some degree of shade, but the better the light conditions, the more you will be rewarded by fine foliage. Experiment in your home to find the perfect spot for your plant
way_of_care.water: Calathea must be kept in damp soil at all times, but definitely do not allow the plant to sit in water or in very wet soil. Think little and often as a watering policy
way_of_care.feed: Apply a weak dose of a nitrogen rich foliage fertiliser once or twice a month during the growing season
way_of_care.temperature: Prefers warm to high temperatures, ideally between 18-23°C but can cope with as low as 15°C. Avoid draughts and ensure the plant has reasonable ventilation

name: String of Hearts
description: Ceropegia woodii ssp. Woodii has small heart shaped leaves with a delightful green lace pattern that grow in opposite pairs along a trailing vine. The pinkish-purple undersides of the leaves and stems add a romantic hue.Also known as Rosary Vine or Chain of Hearts, Ceropegia woodii is not truly a succulent, but it does store water in its stems and plant care is very similar to that of a succulent. String of Hearts is extremely easy to look after and very tolerant of neglect. It is a perfect plant for for hanging baskets.

way_of_care.light: Bright light, including some direct early morning or evening sunlight, will enhance the colour
way_of_care.water: Drought tolerant, but for best results keep the soil lightly moist. water sparingly in winte
way_of_care.feed: A weak solution of balanced fertiliser once a month during summer
way_of_care.temperature: Normal room temperature anywhere between 18-24°C. Protect from draughts.

name: Ctenanthe burle marxii Amabilis
description: Ctenanthe are related to Maranta, Calathea and Stromanthe. All are known and cherished for their extraordinary decorative foliage and are sometimes called Prayer Plants due to the way the leaves close upwards in a prayer-like fashion in the dark.

way_of_care.light: Bright, indirect light. Will tolerate some degree of shade; however insufficient light may cause loss of variegation in the leaves. Too much light on the other hand will cause the leaves to fade
way_of_care.water: Keep soil moist at all times. Allow the top of the soil to dry out slightly before watering.
way_of_care.feed: pply a weak dose of a liquid fertiliser once or twice a month during the growing season.
way_of_care.temperature: Normal room temperatures from 16-24°C but can cope with as low as 13°C..

name: Ctenanthe burle marxii Amagris
description: Ctenanthe burle marxii Amagris is slow growing with pale grey-green, oval leaves and dramatic dark green curving stripes. The leaves are wonderfully offset by a deep purple stem and leaf underside.

way_of_care.light: Bright, indirect light. Will tolerate some degree of shade; however insufficient light may cause loss of variegation in the leaves. Too much light on the other hand will cause the leaves to fade
way_of_care.water: Keep soil moist at all times. Allow the top of the soil to dry out slightly before watering.
way_of_care.feed: Apply a weak dose of a liquid fertiliser once or twice a month during the growing season.
way_of_care.temperature: Normal room temperatures from 16-24°C but can cope with as low as 13°C.

name: Dracaena fragrans White Jewel
description: A white variegated Dracaena. The strong white striping contrasts beautifully with the broad leafed deep green background and the hint of lighter green stripes. Elegance in a pot!

way_of_care.light: Dracaena White Jewel is a versatile plant, coping with light shade through to bright, indirect light. Avoid direct sunlight.
way_of_care.water: Water when the soil starts to dry out at the top, water well and allow to drain thoroughly. Dracaena are relatively drought tolerant. Do not over water as this will cause the leaf tips to blacken.
way_of_care.feed: Apply a weak dose of a fertiliser once or twice a month during the growing season
way_of_care.temperature: Average household temperatures between 16-24°C but can cope with as low as 12°C for short periods.

name: Epipremnum aureum - Golden Pothos
description: Epipremnum aureum has large, glossy green leaves with irregular cream and yellow streaks and blotches that are valued for their air-purifying qualities. Golden Pothos also tolerates lower light levels without losing its variegation. Commonly used as a hanging plant, Devil's Ivy also works really well grown up a moss pole.

way_of_care.water: Water when slightly dry. Drought tolerant. Too much water will kill the plant.
way_of_care.feed: Apply a weak general purpose fertiliser during the summer.
way_of_care.temperature: Happy in normal room temperatures from 10-24°C.

name: Epipremnum aureum Neon - Golden Neon Pothos
description: Epipremnum aureum Neon is a wonderfully vibrant variety of Golden Pothos, with bright chartreuse yellow leaves with no variegation. Golden Pothos is valued for its air-purifying qualities and tolerance of lower light levels. It looks best displayed as a hanging plant.

way_of_care.water: Water when slightly dry. Drought tolerant. Too much water will kill the plant.
way_of_care.feed: Apply a weak general purpose fertiliser during the summer.
way_of_care.temperature: Happy in normal room temperatures from 10-24°C.

name: Epipremnum pictum Silvery Ann - Satin Pothos
description: Closely related to Epipremnum pictum Argyraeus and Trebie, Silvery Ann is predominantly silvery on top of heart shaped green leaves. It is compact and slow growing and ideal as a hanging plant.

way_of_care.water: Water when slightly dry. Drought tolerant. Too much water will kill the plant.
way_of_care.feed: Apply a weak general purpose fertiliser during the summer.
way_of_care.temperature: Happy in normal room temperatures from 10-24°C.
